page.title: 06Women's Institute
page.content: This Women's Institute was founded in I9I9.To_day it has 33 members, the majority of whom are over the age of 50. Young village women are reluctant to join as they feel the W.I. has a dated image.Also educational classes are readily available for crafts, cookery,gardening, etc through the Government subsidised adult education W.I. classes are held in lampshade making, breadmaking, and computers and others. Fund raising events are held each year for various charities ie the Guide dogs for the blind, Mentally Handicapped children, and the Red Cross. These include a Fashion Show, Coffee mornings, Bring and Buy Stalls, and a Summer Fete. To_days W.I. is a friendly monthly gathering, where friendships can be made, new things learned, and hopefully village life enjoyed.
